page.title: 06Badger Protest at Folkington
page.content:
The badger protest is an organisation run by the Brighton Animal Right campaigners and the Folkington Badger Action group. They are protesting about the tests done on badgers. These tests are to see if they are the cause of Bovine Tuberculosis,which has already caused eight cattle to be slaughtered in the area. The tests include skin, blood and urine tests and are carried out at Weybridge in Surrey.If the tests are positive the badgers are to be gassed.
The Ministry of Agriculture have laid about ninety traps,all of them have mysteriously disappeared. The Badger Protesters camp has been in Folkington woods since June 1984 but the cold winter together with the lack of supporters and funds have forced the campaigners to leave in Summer 1985.
